TEI.2.document_title: Alexander Thomson to Stephen F Austin, 11-13-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: Alexander Thomson to Austin, Tenoxtitlan, November 13, 1830. Informs Austin of the attempt of Piedras to detain his own and four other families at Nacogdoches in obedience to orders from Terán concerning the law of April 6, 1830. Suggests action by Austin.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Alexander Thomson to Austin, Tenoxtitlan, November 13, 1830. Informs Austin of the attempt of Piedras to detain his own and four other families at Nacogdoches in obedience to orders from Terán concerning the law of April 6, 1830. Suggests action by Austin.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Tenoxtitlan*/location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="11-18-1830">—Novr 18th 1830*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*Respected sir,*/p*
*p*I am unacquainted with you personally, yet situated as I am, I think it necessary, to address you, and apprise you of a considerable difficulity, that now exist in the settlement of your *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, and the others also; namely, the order from *person_mentioned*General Teran*/person_mentioned*, to the *person_mentioned*Colo at *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* to suffer no person to pass, unless, they have a passport, I was not apprised of that order, and came here, I think on the *date_mentioned n="10-28-1830">28 ultmo—*/date_mentioned*, the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*informed me when the *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*came into *location_mentioned*town*/location_mentioned* I must collect them all together, and present them, I done so, then the *person_mentioned*Coll*/person_mentioned*, sent for me, and inform'd me that he had the Saturday before recd- the above mentioned order and could not consistent with his order, let me pass, but as we were ignorant of the late Law, and as we had compleatly complyed with the Colonization Law, having our certificates Legally arra[n]ged, by the proper *person_mentioned*authorities*/person_mentioned*, he would venture to give five of us a permit to you, who he said was authorised to give us passports; but the *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*must remain until our return, we had traveled better than 8 weeks, had spent a great deal of money, and was much fatigued, we could not feel willing to remain in that part of the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*on expences so Long, we therefore came round, which caus'd us to loose 2 1/2 days travel, we are now at the *location_mentioned*barracks*/location_mentioned*, at *person_mentioned*Mr Williams*/person_mentioned* that is the *person_mentioned*families*/person_mentioned*, We arrived there *date_mentioned n="11-12-1830">Last night*/date_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="11-13-1830">Today */date_mentioned*I came up to the *location_mentioned*new garrison*/location_mentioned* to see the *person_mentioned*commander */person_mentioned*here he says that he has recd the same order, and advises us to remain where we are, until he receives further orders in answer to his letter that he had writen after *person_mentioned*Majr Robertson */person_mentioned*had inform'd him that I was on the road, which answer he expected would arrive in *date_mentioned n="11-17-1830">four days*/date_mentioned*, mean-while he gave us permission to explore the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, which we intend to do immediately— *person_mentioned*Col. Thorn*/person_mentioned* has sent you a letter by me on the subject. We, him and myself think it advisable for you to have an *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*appointed in *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned*, he says he is willing to act for you if you wish him, but he expected to start in a day or two for *location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* and be absent two months, There ought to be some person there authorised immediately, for since I left there I have been informed of two more *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*that have been stoped, and detain'd,- I have been particular in giving the particulars of my detention, to you, in order, that, you may have a clear view of the impediment, *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*will meet with in comeing to the *location_mentioned*colonies*/location_mentioned*— So soon as I can, I expect to see you, but can not for a few days,— *person_mentioned*Majr Robertson*/person_mentioned* has inform'd you that I am interested in the settlement of this *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Alexander Thomson*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Colo S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Phillipi De Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
